thread.title: Northwestern boys soccer team beats Salisbury in Colonial League semifinals
thread.title_full: Northwestern boys soccer team beats Salisbury in Colonial League semifinals

title: Northwestern boys soccer team beats Salisbury in Colonial League semifinals
text:
Complete Box Score » 
Northwestern 2, Salisbury 0 — Rapid Recap 
Senior JD Haaf scored two first-half goals as top-seeded Northwestern beat fourth-seeded Salisbury 2-0 on Tuesday night in the Colonial League semifinals at Northern Lehigh High School. 
Turning point : Haaf used some nifty footwork to get away from a defender and dribble up the sideline, before finding the back of the net with 21 seconds left in the first half to make it 2-0 Northwestern. It gave the Tigers complete control heading into the half. 
Top performer: Haaf had both goals to lead the Tigers into Thursday night's championship game. Both of them came in the final 10 minutes of the first half. Haaf took a pass from Kenneth Gawelko , turned around and drilled it into the net with 9:38 left before intermission. He then had an unassisted goal with 21 seconds left in the half to extend the lead to two goals. 
What it means : The Tigers will play second-seeded Moravian Academy in Thursday night's final. The second-seeded Lions beat Southern Lehigh 1-0 in the other semifinal. Northwestern (17-1) also avenged its only loss of the season, a 1-0 defeat to the Falcons on Oct. 1.
